p: On average, we found that 4.5 Â± 3.6% of the global wheat-growing area was affected by SWS each year between 1911 and 2016, with the maximum extent being nearly 15% in 2010 and 2012. The increase in the average area affected by SWS between 1911 and 2000 was small (0.4 percentage points per decade) yet significant ( P = 0.035); however, this rate increased to 2.9 percentage points per decade between 2001 and 2016, coinciding with a global increase in wheat prices.
